results.content: Best Gutenberg block creation course I've found. Lee walks you through using NPM and Webpack - setting up a variety of plugins in a very straight forward and easy to use language. The only downside is that some of the code is not compatible with Gutenberg since it was incorporated into WordPress core. Ten minutes research will get you out of trouble and will help you understand how it all works together even better. I will be keeping an eye out for Lee's advanced block creation course!
results.content_html: Best Gutenberg block creation course I've found. Lee walks you through using NPM and Webpack - setting up a variety of plugins in a very straight forward and easy to use language. The only downside is that some of the code is not compatible with Gutenberg since it was incorporated into WordPress core. Ten minutes research will get you out of trouble and will help you understand how it all works together even better. I will be keeping an eye out for Lee's advanced block creation course!

results.content: Great course. Already built a few new blocks. I can't wait to learn more from Lee in the future.
results.content_html: Great course. Already built a few new blocks. I can't wait to learn more from Lee in the future.

results.content: Great that not only there were demo examples of how to build blocks in a development environment but also how to make the architecture scalable and how to put everything in production mode. Great!
results.content_html: Great that not only there were demo examples of how to build blocks in a development environment but also how to make the architecture scalable and how to put everything in production mode. Great!

results.content:
This course is exactly as advertised in Lee's the intro video. If you enjoy learning by jumping right in and building something rather than a lot of theory, this is probably a good course for you. And if you choose to learn more theory later, it will probably make more sense because you've already seen it in action.

Lee is very honest about what he knows and how he got to that point, so this course feels more like a friend  walking you things they've learned rather than attending a lecture.

I can't speak for best practices because I'm just getting started, but I think this is a good jumping off point to get your feet wet with Gutenberg blocks.
results.content_html:

results.content: Good introduction to the topic. Even React knowledge will not be needed. It would be nice to update it for WP5.0 and newer node modules versions (following instructions 1 to 1 will not work, now). There are some small mistakes (ex. strange habit of defining node modules, that are already in package.json), but they do not interfere with learning. All in all, It's quite good beginner course with learning-thru-example approach.
results.content_html: Good introduction to the topic. Even React knowledge will not be needed. It would be nice to update it for WP5.0 and newer node modules versions (following instructions 1 to 1 will not work, now). There are some small mistakes (ex. strange habit of defining node modules, that are already in package.json), but they do not interfere with learning. All in all, It's quite good beginner course with learning-thru-example approach.

results.content:
UPDATE: Lee is very responsive in the course questions area and is providing updated code samples. He's also promised to release major updates to the course this week to reflect the latest versions/APIs.

I really appreciate the attitude that Lee has taken. He clearly has spent countless hours painstakingly exploring this new topic to try to provide the most frustration-free path possible.

However, there are a number of things that are outdated already (use of babel-core, babel-preset-env instead of @babel/core, @babel/preset-env, WordPress 4.9 vs 5.0, etc.).

Additionally, the Gutenberg APIs have changed and even simple things like loading the front end styles for a block will not work if you follow the exact code samples Lee provides (which were compatible with WP 4.9 + Gutenberg plugin). So far, I've had to spend about an equal amount of time researching on my own how to properly update my code for WP 5.0.2 as I've spent in the actual course to get my code to run as expected.

I hope he updates this course soon to reflect the latest versions. But I understand this is a rapidly developing topic so it may be an unrealistic ask to say the course should be updated every other week with new versions of WP/Gutenberg.

results.content:
There are few learning resources for WordPress developers to get a handle on the new Gutenberg editor. Lee has taken a deep dive and is sharing his knowledge. By going through this course you will definitely make fewer mistakes when trying to implement blocks into WordPress themes yourself. 

It is easy to follow but it would help if you have a little bit of React & ES6 understanding up-front.
results.content_html:
There are few learning resources for WordPress developers to get a handle on the new Gutenberg editor. Lee has taken a deep dive and is sharing his knowledge. By going through this course you will definitely make fewer mistakes when trying to implement blocks into WordPress themes yourself.

It is easy to follow but it would help if you have a little bit of React & ES6 understanding up-front.

results.content: This is a useful course. There are some rough parts where the structure of the lecture feels a little improvised and unprepared, and sorta like a first draft, but the instructor is responsive in the Questions Forum and does a good job of presenting the material overall.
results.content_html: This is a useful course. There are some rough parts where the structure of the lecture feels a little improvised and unprepared, and sorta like a first draft, but the instructor is responsive in the Questions Forum and does a good job of presenting the material overall.

results.content: A great walkthrough of a beta phase product. It is a little frustrating the rate at which the dependencies and Gutenberg are changing. As good as the teacher and tutorials are I had to do some research myself to find the newest answers to the problems I was encountering. Thankfully the Q&A sections had other viewers experiencing the same problems and I was able to get up and running relatively quickly. This is by no means a critique of the tutorials series, but something to keep in mind when purchasing the product. The landscape is literally changing on a day by day, week by week basis. You may need to do some of your own research when learning these cutting edge technologies as it is extremely difficult to keep 100% up to date with how fast this is evolving.

results.content: This course was really helpful to get a basic to intermediate understanding of Gutenberg Blocks, as a bonus Lee does a great job at helping you get better acquainted with the command line, React, NPM and Webpack. There were one or two instances where the code was out of date and doesn't use certain packages the way Lee was using them, but a quick google of the error will help you find the correct method. Enjoy :-)

There were one or two instances where the code was out of date and doesn't use certain packages the way Lee was using them, but a quick google of the error will help you find the correct method. results.content: The only issue I had is sometimes the code was left blurred out too long. I found this frustrating and one reason I did not give the course 5 stars.

results.content: There are a few hiccups on my end here and there as things have changed a bit in Gutenberg. Overall, this course has been very helpful.
results.content_html: There are a few hiccups on my end here and there as things have changed a bit in Gutenberg. Overall, this course has been very helpful.

results.content: Lee was incredibly responsive when I ran into issues.  Even though these processes are somewhat new to me as a frontend developer stuck in old workflows (little command line or npm experience), it is just the right level for me to start wrapping my head around concepts.  I've been able to successfully create some blocks, and will go back and redo a few sections to try to understand some of the stuff at a deeper level, which will require some digging.  So far, very happy with the course!  I don't see any SASS integration in this course, which is ok, because I think Lee has given me the know-how to get it up and running.

results.content:
Interesting... this open new horizons in WordPress development... and it will  make you switch to modern Javascript development (ES6 and React)...
That also shows in a certain way that Gutenberg is not  "Hell in WordPress", otherwise it opens new perspectives for the future of WordPress.

results.content:
Great Course To take the basics of building blocks, 

Ways to improve: 
- Speeding Up the recording when typing code 
- Eliminating some repetition, I mean setting up json file and webpack, we could just copy packages.json and run npm install to install all the packages that we need :) 

Thank you!
